title: Murphy Maverick
text:
The Murphy Maverick is a Canadian two-seat fixed-wing <a href="Ultralight%20aircraft%20%28Canada%29">ultralight</a> <a href="monoplane">monoplane</a> designed by <a href="Murphy%20Aircraft">Murphy Aircraft</a> of British Columbia. The type is sold as a kit for <a href="Homebuilt%20aircraft">home construction</a> or as a complete ready-to-fly aircraft.
Development.
Designed as a smaller version of the <a href="Murphy%20Rebel">Rebel</a>, the Maverick is an all-metal high-wing braced monoplane with two side-by-side seats and a <a href="conventional%20landing%20gear">tailwheel landing gear</a>. The aircraft was designed around the <a href="Rotax%20503">Rotax 503</a> powerplant, with the goal of producing an economical ultralight trainer. As a homebuilt it can also be fitted with a number of different piston engines including the <a href="HKS%20700">HKS 700</a>, <a href="Rotax%20582">Rotax 582</a> and <a href="Jabiru%202200">Jabiru 2200</a>.
The aircraft is mainly built from sheet aluminium, with the tail and rear sections of the wings <a href="Aircraft%20fabric%20covering">fabric covered</a> to save weight. The wings are constructed using a "D" cell, with stamped ribs and a single wing <a href="strut">strut</a>. The standard wing span on the Maverick is , but an optional wing extension is available to increase the wingspan to reduce the wing loading.
The standard landing gear is of a <a href="conventional%20landing%20gear">taildragger</a> configuration and <a href="bungee%20cord">bungee suspended</a>, with sprung steel main gear as an option. Additional options include wing-mounted fuel tanks and fittings for installing <a href="floatplane">floats</a>.
